sen.j: 島津荘（しまづのしょう）は、平安時代～鎌倉時代初期にかけて南九州にあった大荘園。
sen.e: Shimazu no Sho (Shimazu Manor) was a large manor located in southern Kyushu from the Heian period to the first part of the Kamakura period.
Shimazu no Sho (Shimazu Manor) was a large manor located in southern Kyushu from the Heian period to the first part of the Kamakura period.
Shimazu no Sho (Shimazu Manor) was a large manor located in southern Kyushu from the Heian period to the first part of the Kamakura period.
It was the territory of the Sekkan-ke (the families which produced the Regent and the Chief Adviser to the Emperor).
It was the territory of the Sekkan-ke (the families which produced the Regent and the Chief Adviser to the Emperor).
It was the territory of the Sekkan-ke (the families which produced the Regent and the Chief Adviser to the Emperor).
It was the largest manor in Japan.
It was the largest manor in Japan.
It was the largest manor in Japan.

sen.j: 日向国中南部と大隅国と薩摩国。
sen.e: South-central Hyuga Province, Osumi Province and Satsuma Province.
South-central Hyuga Province, Osumi Province and Satsuma Province.
South-central Hyuga Province, Osumi Province and Satsuma Province.

sen.j: 現在の宮崎県中南部と鹿児島県。
sen.e: Modern-day south-central Miyazaki Province and Kagoshima Province.
Modern-day south-central Miyazaki Province and Kagoshima Province.
Modern-day south-central Miyazaki Prefecture and Kagoshima Prefecture.
More than 8,000 cho (872,720m²) at its peak
More than 8,000 cho (872,720m²) at its peak
More than 8,000 cho (approximately 79,336,000 square meters) at its peak.
sen.cmt: 1町（面積）＝約9917m2のため、872,720m²→approximately 79,336,000 square metersに修正、ピリオド追加 (参考: http://homepage3.nifty.com/such/shumi/shumi3/area.html)

sen.e: Origin
Origin
Origin

sen.j: 万寿3年(1026年)に大宰大監の平季基が開発し、関白の藤原頼通に寄進。
sen.e: Shimazu Manor was developed in 1026 by Dazai-fu Daikan (director of the local government office in the Kyushu region) TAIRA no Suemoto and dedicated to Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) FUJIWARA no Yorimichi.

Shimazu Manor was developed in 1026 by Dazai-fu Daikan (director of the local government office in the Kyushu region) TAIRA no Suemoto and dedicated to Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) FUJIWARA no Yorimichi.

Shimazu Manor was developed in 1026 by Dazai no Daigen (director of the local government office in the Kyushu region) TAIRA no Suemoto and dedicated to Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) FUJIWARA no Yorimichi.
sen.cmt: Dazai-fu Daikan→Dazai no Daigenとしました。(参考: http://www.page.sannet.ne.jp/gutoku2/daigen.html)

sen.e: Head Family
Head Family
Head Family

sen.j: 摂関家(藤原頼通→藤原忠実→藤原泰子→藤原忠実→藤原基実→平盛子→藤原基通)
sen.e: Sekkan-ke (FUJIWARA no Yorimichi > FUJIWARA no Tadazane > FUJIWARA no Taishi > FUJIWARA no Tadazane > FUJIWARA no Motozane > TAIRA no Seishi > FUJIWARA no Motomichi)
Sekkan-ke (FUJIWARA no Yorimichi > FUJIWARA no Tadazane > FUJIWARA no Taishi > FUJIWARA no Tadazane > FUJIWARA no Motozane > TAIRA no Seishi > FUJIWARA no Motomichi)

sen.j: 摂関家家司(三位大夫)→興福寺一乗院
sen.e: Sekkan-ke Steward (FUJIWARA no Nariko) > Kofuku-ji Temple > Ichijo-in Temple
Sekkan-ke Steward (FUJIWARA no Nariko) > Kofuku-ji Temple > Ichijo-in Temple

sen.j: 平氏・伴氏・藤原氏など有力豪族。
sen.e: Powerful families such as the Taira clan, Tomo clan and Fujiwara clan
Powerful families such as the Taira clan, Tomo clan and Fujiwara clan
Powerful families such as the Taira clan, Tomo clan and Fujiwara clan

sen.j: 文治2年(1186年)に鎌倉幕府は地頭として惟宗忠久(島津忠久)を差し向けて支配させた。
sen.e: In 1186, the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) appointed Tadahisa KOREMUNE (Tadahisa SHIMAZU) to administer the manor as jito (manager and lord of manor).
In 1186, the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) appointed Tadahisa KOREMUNE (Tadahisa SHIMAZU) to administer the manor as jito (manager and lord of manor).
In 1186, the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) appointed Tadahisa KOREMUNE (Tadahisa SHIMAZU) to administer the manor as jito (manager and lord of manor).

sen.j: 忠久は比企氏の乱で一時失脚するも後に復権、戦国大名島津氏の経済基盤になるにいたる。
sen.e: After Tadahisa was briefly overthrown in a conflict with the Hiki clan, the manor was reinstated and became an economic base of Shimazu clan of daimyo (territorial lords).
After Tadahisa was briefly overthrown in a conflict with the Hiki clan, the manor was reinstated and became an economic base of Shimazu clan of daimyo (territorial lords).

After Tadahisa was briefly overthrown in a conflict with the Hiki clan, the manor was reinstated and became an economic base of the Shimazu clan of Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lord in the Sengoku period).
sen.cmt: the Shimazu clanとし、「戦国大名」の表記を統一リストに基づき修正
